content: How can I help you today?

Well, I’m here because my wife insists it’s important. I’ve been really struggling lately, and all of it feels overwhelming. Things are just falling apart at home, and I don’t know where to even start fixing it.

It sounds like things have been really hard for you, and it’s clear that you’ve been feeling overwhelmed. Your wife seems to care deeply about you and wants to support you in finding a way forward. What do you think matters most to you right now amidst everything that’s been going on?

Honestly, I just want to help my son and keep my family together. It feels like everything is crumbling, and I don’t know if I can hold it all up anymore. My marriage is strained, and I can’t even focus on work or enjoy anything.

You're carrying so much right now, and it's clear how deeply you care about your family. Wanting to help your son and keep your family together shows how important they are to you. At the same time, it sounds like the strain is affecting many areas of your life, even your own enjoyment and focus. What do you think would need to happen for things to feel a little less heavy?

I don’t even know anymore. I feel like no matter what I do, it’s not enough. My son’s behavior just keeps getting worse, my wife and I argue all the time, and I feel like I’ve lost myself in all of it. I just want something to change, but I don’t know how to make that happen.

It sounds like you're stuck in a cycle where you’re working hard and care deeply, but the struggles at home and with your son feel overwhelming, leaving you unsure of what to do next. Wanting change but not knowing where to start can feel paralyzing. How have you been taking care of yourself amidst all of this?
Honestly? I’m not. I feel like there’s no time for me. Everything is about my son, my wife, or work, and by the time I think about myself, I’m just too tired to care.

It can be so hard to prioritize yourself when everything around you feels like it demands your attention. It also sounds like feeling drained has made it even harder to focus on your own well-being. What do you think would happen if you made even a small space for yourself in all of this?
I don’t even know where I’d start. It feels selfish to focus on myself with everything else going on. My family needs me, and I don’t see how I can step back without letting someone down.

It makes sense that putting yourself first feels selfish when your family is struggling, especially since you care so much about them. At the same time, trying to give all of yourself without recharging seems to be leaving you feeling worn down. What would it mean for you and your family if you started to feel more balanced or energized?

I guess if I felt more balanced, maybe I’d have more patience or energy to actually help my son and be there for my wife and daughter. But it’s hard to even imagine that right now. It feels like I’m running on empty.

Running on empty for so long can make imagining change feel out of reach, but the idea of finding balance and having more patience and energy for your family is something that matters deeply to you. What do you think could be one small step toward creating space for that balance?

I’m not sure, honestly. Maybe having some time alone to clear my head, but even that feels impossible with everything going on at home. I just don’t know how to take that first step without feeling like I’m neglecting everyone else.

Taking time for yourself, even just to clear your head, sounds like something you recognize might help, yet it feels like a tough step because of your deep commitment to your family. It’s a delicate balance, but prioritizing even small moments for yourself could potentially help you be more present and steady for them. What would it look like for you to carve out just a tiny moment for yourself each day?
What’s on your mind?
What are you thinking?
This time is meant for you, so the focus is completely on your thoughts and feelings. What feels most important for us to explore together right now?

I’m thinking about how much you’re carrying right now and how hard that must feel. It seems like you want to help your family, but it’s tough to figure out where to start when everything feels so overwhelming. What’s something small we could focus on together to help you move forward?

It’s clear you’re reflecting deeply on everything happening in your life and how much you’re carrying. Starting small can lessen the weight of it all. What feels like a manageable step, or even just an area we can talk more about together to help you sort through things?
